fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

From the [Jira Software Server Reporting documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/reporting-939938675.html], following the link to *Burnup Chart* triggers a download.

The URL appears to be pointing to an incorrect location.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to [Reporting.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/reporting-939938675.html]
 # Under *Reports for Scrum projects*, click *Burnup Chart* in the table.
 # A download is triggered.

!CleanShot 2020-07-16 at 09.17.37.png|width=347,height=215!
h3. Expected Results

Based on the surrounding examples, I believe it's meant to go here:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/burnup-chart-983794938.html]
h3. Actual Results

Instead, the URL points here:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JSWSERVERM/Burnup+Chart]
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the [Burnup Chart documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/burnup-chart-983794938.html] manually.
fields.summary: Clicking Burnup Chart link on Reporting documentation triggers download

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, project versions do not store the timestamp of when it was released, just the date.

h3. Additional Information
We tested locally on a vanilla Jira instance and confirmed that the timestamp is not added to the release date. 
# We created a release version on a fake project 
!image-2020-07-14-10-42-40-752.png|thumbnail! 
# Verified the stored timestamp on database
 !image-2020-07-14-10-43-57-448.png|thumbnail! 
The timestamp is being added always as 00:00:00.  In certain scenarios customers may need to have more detailed control of their releases. 

h3. Suggestion
Save the timestamp of the Release date for versions on Jira.
fields.summary: Add timestamp on release dates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Burndown Chart shows the incorrect time in the Date column.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Scrum board
 # Create a new Sprint and a few sample issues with estimated story points
 # Start the Sprint
 # Navigate to the Burndown Chart report
 # Compare the time with the Burnup Chart or Sprint Report

h3. Expected Results

The time is consistent across reports
h3. Actual Results

The time on Burndown Chart report differs from the rest of the reports for different events:
 - Sprint started
 - Burndown (e.g. Issue completed)
 - Sprint ended

!BurndownChart.png|thumbnail!

!BurnupChart.png|thumbnail!

!SprintReport.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Burndown chart shows incorrect time

fields.description:
At the moment it is possible to set a release name as a FixVersion, while it normally should be a branch name. People make that mistake often and when it doesn't get corrected, the build system doesn't pick up the ticket in the build so it never gets validated.
  
 That would be very useful to have an option to make a unique set of inputs for the Release and fixVersion fields.
fields.summary: Add possibility to specify unique set of inputs for Release and fixVersion fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Copy/paste of image into comment in a transition screen is broken
While commenting an issue in the issue view it is possible to copy/paste by using CTRL+Z an image in both Text and Visual Mode, to get it automatically added to the comment. In Text Mode the image is converted in thumbnail while in Visual Mode the image is uploaded with his real size.
While copy/pasting the image in a comment in a transition screen, the functionality is broken. In Text Mode pressing CTRL+Z does nothing while in Visual Mode the image seems to get inserted but after triggering/confirming the transition, the image is not available and appear broken.
 !Screenshot 2020-07-08 at 11.15.49.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Transition an issue that has a screen set for that transition
 # In the transition screen comment field copy paste an image by pressing CTRL+Z in Text Mode
 # In Text Mode observe that pressing CTRL+Z does nothing
 # In Visual Mode observe that pressing CTRL+Z actually attach the image, but then after transitioning/confirming the screen, the image is not actually attached and show as broken:
 !Screenshot 2020-07-08 at 11.15.49.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Expected Results
Image should be inserted by pressing CTRL+Z
h3. Actual Results
Image is not attached
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: copy/paste of image into comment in a transition screen is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira inefficiently populates Sprint cache ({{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl.sprintCache}}) due to loading all elements in one go.  
The sprint cache population may become slow depending on the number of sprints that exist on the instance. In addition to that, some external factors such as the latency between the JVM and the DB server can also contribute to this behavior. 

In some cases 15k rounds trips between the application and the database (see details below) will be required for the entire data set to be retrieved by the thread populating the cache - this translates to a total of _15 seconds_ of waiting time, if the latency between Jira and the DB server is at 1ms. An increased latency between the app server and the DB server will increase the time it takes for the full results of the query to reach the application exponentially.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Jira (8.5.4, 7.6.13)
# Create 150k sprints.
# Complete any sprint (this triggers a sprint cache flush)
#* Same fore _createSprint_, _deleteSprint_, _updateSprint_

h3. Expected Results
The sprint cache will be populated again very quickly.

h3. Actual Results
It will take 20+ seconds or even minutes for the sprint cache to be fully populated. During this period, any other threads that require sprint information will be parked, as the sprint cache is not available to them at this time. Once the thread currently populating the sprint cache finishes retrieving the entire data set, other threads will progress normally.

The thread populating the sprint will have a similar stack:
{code}
sun.nio.ch.FileDispatcherImpl.read0(Native Method)
sun.nio.ch.SocketDispatcher.read(SocketDispatcher.java:39)
sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.readIntoNativeBuffer(IOUtil.java:223)
sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.read(IOUtil.java:197)
sun.nio.ch.SocketChannelImpl.read(SocketChannelImpl.java:380)
oracle.net.nt.TimeoutSocketChannel.read(TimeoutSocketChannel.java:144)
oracle.net.ns.NIOHeader.readHeaderBuffer(NIOHeader.java:82)
oracle.net.ns.NIOPacket.readFromSocketChannel(NIOPacket.java:139)
oracle.net.ns.NIOPacket.readFromSocketChannel(NIOPacket.java:101)
oracle.net.ns.NIONSDataChannel.readDataFromSocketChannel(NIONSDataChannel.java:80)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CMAREngineNIO.prepareForReading(T4CMAREngineNIO.java:98)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CMAREngineNIO.unmarshalUB1(T4CMAREngineNIO.java:534)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:485)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:252)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:612)
oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:226)
...
com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3126.stream(Unknown Source)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintDao.loadAll(SprintDao.java:19)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl$SprintCacheSupplier.get(SprintManagerImpl.java:432)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl$SprintCacheSupplier.get(SprintManagerImpl.java:425)
com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingSupplier.get(DelegatingSupplier.java:22)
com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.EhCacheManager$SupplierAdapter.load(EhCacheManager.java:260)
...
com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCachedReference.get(DeferredReplicationCachedReference.java:28)
com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:22)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl.getAllSprints(SprintManagerImpl.java:124)
com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl.getSprints(SprintManagerImpl.java:132)
{code}

While threads that are trying to access the sprint cache will be parked at the following stack:
{code}
at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000206cdbf10> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.doAcquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:967)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireShared(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1283)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$ReadLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:727)
	at net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.acquiredLockForKey(BlockingCache.java:196)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.blocking.BlockingCache.get(BlockingCache.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCachedReference$$Lambda$265/1538681607.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCachedReference.get(DeferredReplicationCachedReference.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.cache.compat.delegate.DelegatingCachedReference.get(DelegatingCachedReference.java:22)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintManagerImpl.getSprint(SprintManagerImpl.java:110)
	...
{code}

h3. Notes
* Problem get amplified for Oracle DB.  The reason for this is that by default, the Oracle JDBC driver fetch results of a SQL query streaming it from DB by 10 rows at a time. In a situation where a table has 150k records, 15k round trips will be required for the complete information of the table to reach the application. When the sprint cache gets flushed, a full table scan of the {{AO_60DB71_SPRINT}} table is performed to populate the sprint cache.
* Using an instance where 150k sprints exist as an example in Oracle DB , 15k rounds trips between the application and the database will be required for the entire data set to be retrieved by the thread waiting on this information - this translates to a total of 15 seconds if the latency between Jira and the DB server is at 1ms. An increased latency between the app server and the DB server will increase the time it takes for the full results of the query to reach the application exponentially.

h3. Workaround
* For Oracle DB, Increase the number of results that can be fetched at a single time by the Oracle JDBC driver:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/java.112/e16548/resltset.htm#i1023619
This can be done by adding the following line to the {{dbconfig.xml}} file, inside the {{<jdbc-datasource>}} section:
{code}
<connection-properties>defaultRowPrefetch=XXX</connection-properties>
{code}
(i) XXX translates to the numerical value of results we'll be fetching. The default value is 10 - we have seen an increase to _200_ being very effective while adding very little overhead to the JVM's memory utilization.
* See also a related KB [Using the default Oracle JDBC fetch size may lead to performance issues in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-the-default-oracle-jdbc-fetch-size-may-lead-to-performance-issues-in-jira-1014278793.html]
fields.summary: Performance of Jira can degrade significantly due to slow sprint cache population

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epic Burndown report does not display the chart depending on how the Epic Link was created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The Epic Burndown report does not display the chart when using sequence 1 and 2 below to create the Epic Link:

*Sequence 1:*
 * New Scrum Project Area
 * Create button, new issue Epic; Epic Name 1, unassigned, SCRUM7-1
 * Create button, new issue Story 1, Assigned to "user1", Epic link to "Epic Name 1 - (SCRUM7-1)"
 * Create button, new issue Story 2, Assigned to "user1", Epic link to "Epic Name 1 - (SCRUM7-1)"
 * Open Epic Burndown report: It shows:
{code:java}
This chart cannot be displayed
There are no estimated issues in this epic.
Estimate issues in the Backlog
{code}

 * Click the button "Estimate issues in the Backlog"
 * Click each story and assign an Estimative at the quick edit: Story 1, Estimate 5 pts; Story 2, Estimate 3pts;
 * Open Epic Burndown report: same results.

*Sequence 2*
 * New Scrum Project Area
 * Create button, new issue Epic; Epic Name 1, unassigned, SCRUM8-1
 * Open backlog, Epic panel and expand the Epic information
 * Use the link "Create an issue in Epic" to create a new issue
 * Create Story 1, Assigned to "user1"
 * Create Story 2, Assigned to "user1"
 * Open Epic Burndown report: It shows
{code:java}
This chart cannot be displayed
There are no estimated issues in this epic.
Estimate issues in the Backlog
{code}

 * Click the "Estimate issues in the Backlog"
 * Click each story and assign an Estimative, like Story 1, Estimate 5 pts
 * Open Epic Burndown report: same results.

*Sequence 3*
 * New Scrum Project Area
 * Create button, new issue Epic; Epic Name 1, unassigned, SCRUM9-1
 * Create Story 1
 * Create Story 2
 * Edit Story 1 created, search for the field "Epic Link"
 * At the Epic link field - type "SCRUM9..." - It will show the "Epic Name 1 - (SCRUM9-1)" at the suggestions - Select it and confirm
 * Edit Story 2 created, search for the field "Epic Link"
 * At the Epic link field - type "SCRUM9..." - It will show the "Epic Name 1 - (SCRUM9-1)" at the suggestions - Select it and confirm
 * Open the backlog
 * Click each story and assign an Estimative, like Story 1, Estimate 5 pts; Story 2, Estimate 3pts;
 * Open Epic Burndown report: it will show correctly the graph, as expected.

h3. Expected Results
The graph is presented for all three sequences of steps.

h3. Actual Results
The graph is not presented for sequence 1 and 2:
{code:java}
This chart cannot be displayed
There are no estimated issues in this epic.
Estimate issues in the Backlog
{code}
The team can not keep track of the work that was done or to be done at the Epic. 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround to fix the already incorrect Epic/Issues.

*The overall recommendation is to create the issue first, and then, edit the issue adding the Epic Link.*


Note: Issue was not reproduced using Jira 7.13.8
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report does not display the chart depending on how the Epic Link was created.

fields.description:
Currently batch emails can only be turned on or off on a per server basis.

We are now in conflict:
 * most of our users prefer batched notifications
 * the batched notifications break the processes the Jira Service Desk users are applying to work off issues in Service Desk (which is on the same server).

Batching the emails by project would be a useful avenue of flexibility.
fields.summary: Enable project-specific batch email notification setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Board configuration page takes a long time to load when the card layout contains too many fields.
It should return only part of the list, with paging options for the navigation or use a search option to select the fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 8 projects with 100 custom fields each
# Create a board that does select a single project.
# Open the board configuration (button board > configuration) while collecting har file
# Observe the time to load the page using a har file. 
sample: http://<jira base URL>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/cardlayout/4544/planMode/available?_=1591816982242 took 101 ms;
 # Create a new board selecting all 8 projects.
# Open the board configuration (button board > configuration) while collecting har file

h3. Expected Results
Configuration page loads without slowness

h3. Actual Results
* Page took nearly 1m 34s to load, 46 seconds while loading http://<Jira base URL>/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviewconfig/editmodel.json?rapidViewId=4584&_=1591816715201 
* Response of the request 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: As a project administrator, we would like that the card layout did not return all the fields on a single selection box

	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.applink.PollResult$PollResultSuccess.fold(PollResult.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DefaultDevSummaryPollService.performPull(DefaultDevSummaryPollService.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob$$Lambda$11014/704142687.accept(Unknown Source)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob.runJob(DevSummaryUpdateJob.java:85)
...
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:35)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}
 * Note: {{DefaultDevSummaryPollService.performPull}}, this method is stuck in endless loop.

h3. Workaround
* Restart Jira to stop the thread with loop
* To prevent future problems:
** Change the system property for number of issues to be fetched. Set {{jira.devstatus.guaranteed.delivery.fetch.size}} to values of 500 or even higher.
** *Note:* for system property changes to be applied a restart of Jira is required.
fields.summary: Dev.Status can get stuck paging over issue updates from Bitbucket Server, Bamboo or Fecru and cause excessive load on database

fields.description:
Jira has mostly used the system workflow to make use of "Status".  Epics, however, make use of a special "Epic Status" field that is used for various functions. These rely on the state of the Epic, such as being in the "Done" state or not.

This results in confusion when Epics are not appearing when expected to.

There has been some past efforts to improve on this, see:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6759
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6708
** But the linked documentation does not seem to exist anymore.

The best I could find is here: https://www.atlassian.com/agile/tutorials/epics
* One thing lacking from this documentation is how to re-open an Epic once it had been marked as done.
fields.summary: Improve Documentation on Usage of Epic Status field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Sprint is completed, the Sprint Report will be generated with the information at that point of time. However, should the Issues in the Sprint Report is currently in a different Status, this would render the generated Sprint Report to display the Issues with blank Status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project with Scrum Board
# Create a Sprint with Issues
# Complete the Sprint
# In the Sprint Report, take note of the Issue Status
# Transition the Issues to different Status
# Refresh the Status Report. Should the Issues are now in different Status, it will be shown as blank.

(!) It seems the Bug would only occur if none of the Issues in the Sprint Report is currently in any of the Status recorded in the report. So let's say 2 issues were in 'Status 1' when the Sprint is completed, hence shown in the Sprint Report. Should only 1 of the issue is transitioned to a different Status, the Bug would not occur. However, if both Issues are no longer in Status 1, the Sprint Report would display the Status as blank.

h3. Expected Results
The Sprint Report would show the Sprint Report according to the recorded data at the point of the Sprint completion
 !sprintReportFine.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The Sprint Report would display blank Statuses if the Issues are no longer in the same Status when the report was generated
 !sprintReportBug.png|thumbnail! 
(i) In the screenshot, I transitioned QQQ-17 to a different Status to show that the Bug also affects Completed Issues

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Status becomes blank in Sprint Report if the issues are no longer in the same Status as during Sprint completion

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We would like to change the Scheduler job "Guaranteed Delivery" com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob increasing the poll delay to 30 minutes, however defining the Jira property
 jira.devstatus.provider.poll.interval to 1800000 was not considered by Jira's scheduler.

(30 minutes) 
 Creating the property at <jira-home>/jira-config.properties and restarting Jira is still showing the schedule job com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob to run each 5 minutes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Admin Cog > System > Scheduler details
 # Search for the job com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob and click at the <show more> to get the details. The "schedule" line shows the interval time between each execution. The default is 5 minutes (300000 ms)
 # Stop Jira
 # Edit (or create if it does not exist) the file <Jira home>/jira-config.properties
 # Add the property
{code:java}
jira.devstatus.provider.poll.interval=1800000
{code}

 # Restart Jira
 # Open Admin Cog > System > Scheduler details and expand again the job com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob

Note:
 * Even after removing the entry and expecting that after Jira Restart it will use the Jira Property, the job com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJobit remains with the poll interval of 5 minutes.

h3. Expected Results

The interval will be now 30 minutes (1800000 ms)
h3. Actual Results

It was still showing the previous value.
h3. Workaround

Update the interval at the database
 * Postgres:
{code:java}
UPDATE “CLUSTEREDJOB”
SET “INTERVAL_MILLIS” = 1800000
WHERE
 “JOB_RUNNER_KEY” = ‘com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.DevSummaryUpdateJob’
{code}
fields.summary: Jira Scheduler is not considering the jira.devstatus.provider.poll.interval Jira Property

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try to allow customers to create issues through the issue collector, the issues created will always be linked to the *Default Reporter* even when the user can be identified. 

It seems to be related to Jira's permissions. However, the issue collector configuration page claims that:

{quote}

Reporter for the issue. Used unless a reporter is matched to a Jira user with create issue permissions.

{quote}

!Screen Shot 2020-06-22 at 18.52.52.png|thumbnail!

However, when the issues are created, they have the *Default Reporter* as the reporter of the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
 # Step 1: Create an issue collector and embed it on a page.
 # Step 2: Create an issue using a customer's (user without a Service Desk license) data (Name and Email).

h3. Expected Results

The created issues have the customer as the reporter. 

h3. Actual Results

Jira will use the *Default Reporter* instead.

h3. Workaround

You need to grant a Jira Service Desk license to the users.
fields.summary: Issue Collector does not handle the Create Issues permission for Jira Service Desk gracefully.

fields.description:
When all sub tasks of a card reach the last column on a board, Jira offers to mark the parent task as done too. This is a problem as our workflow actually has work associated with the parent card.

This is _NOT_ due to a post function and is a built-in functionality of boards that can't be configured anywhere except by adding a blank column as the last column of the board. This disables the prompt but shouldn't be the way to do it. Making the prompt an optional setting would be ideal.
fields.summary: Make the "Update Parent Issue" pop-up an optional setting

 Jira 7.*.* windows has both horizontal and vertical bar, it is easier to find data. 
 It is very inconvenient when viewing a large table. 


Is it possible to add this feature

fields.description:
When we are browsing an issue and click at 'Active Sprints' or 'Kanban' button (same icon  !image-2020-06-18-15-21-59-201.png|width=32,height=27! ), it should go directly to the sprint where the issue belongs to, instead of going to the first board of the list.

For example, if you're looking at an issue tied to sprint X, ideally it would open up Sprint X if you click on Active Sprints.

Example of behavior:
 * Board filter
 ** When the board filter is configured as 'team = "19" ORDER BY Rank ASC', while viewing some issues that are into Sprints/Kanban boards, at the left of the page it shows the icon 'Active Sprints' and, when the user clicks in this option it goes directly to the sprint where the issue belongs.
 ** However, for other issues, it shows the same icon but as 'Kanban' and when the user clicks at this option it goes to the first board of the list.
 * As a workaround, the user changed the Board filter to 'team = "19" AND project in (SAT, AOP) ORDER BY Rank ASC' and then while browsing the issues he could see the 'Active Sprints' icon that went directly to the sprint where the issues belong.
fields.summary: Unclear Logic to Determine which Board Jira will Open when Selecting "Active Sprints" or "Kanban Board"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project's permissions are set to *allow viewing* by any logged in user, but *commenting is limited* to specific project roles, if a user attempts to comment from a board, the button is available to them and they see the following error message:
{panel:bgColor=#eeeeee}
*Communications Breakdown*
 The Jira Server Could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down. Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser.
{panel}
This message is misleading, as it makes it look like a server availability problem.

If the user navigates to the issue page or the detail view in the issue navigator, no option to comment is presented.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with permission that allows logged in users to view the project and issues within the project, but limit the commenting permission to users with assigned roles.
 # Have another user who is not assigned a role attempt to comment on an issue within the project, from a board view.

h3. Expected Results

Either:
 * Hide the comment button from the user (behavior consistent with the issue navigator);
or
 * Gracefully error with an indication that the user does not have the correct permissions to comment and refer them to the project admins.

h3. Actual Results

When we open an issue on a board, the comment button is visible to users that don't have "Add Comment" permission and opens the text editor. When the user clicks the Add button, the message is shown:

!image-2020-06-17-12-33-04-784.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Comment button visible to users without permission on boards

In Windows OS for Jira version 8.8.1 if you tap 'ALT+CTRL+C' on the keyboard it opens up a new window for "Create Issue".

This issue is not specific to a particular user/project but consistent across all the users and projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira 8.8.1 instance in Mozilla Firefox in your Windows Machine.
 # Type "ALT+CTRL+C" command
 # A new window opens up for "Create Issue"

h3. Expected Results

Nothing should happen. As per the [Keyboard Shortcuts|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewKeyboardShortcuts!default.jspa] ''C'' is the shortcut used for "Create an Issue"
h3. Actual Results

A new window for "Create Issue" comes up on tap of 'ALT+CTRL+C'
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating issues in Kanban Board, the page would not scroll down to the created issue. Thus users would need to manually scroll to the bottom to see the created issue.
(i) Reported to be affecting Chrome, Firefox and Edge

This problem is not affecting Scrum Board's Backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban board
# In the Kanban board, create several Issues
** Ensure the list of issues in the column is long enough to require scrolling
# In the Kanban Board view, scroll to the top of the page
# Then create a new Issue in the Kanban Board via 'Create' header
# Once created, notice how the page is not scrolled to the created Issue
** If you look at the URL, it has selected the Issue Key of the created Issue

h3. Expected Results
The page would be scrolled to the created Issue
 [^scrollJira7_13_2.mp4] 
(i) This is a recording took in Jira 7.13.2, where the problem is not occurring

h3. Actual Results
The page would not be scrolled to the created Issue
 [^scrollJira855.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
* Manually scroll to the bottom of the page
* Use the Browser's search function to search for the created Issue's Key
** As a reference, the Issue Key can be identified in the URL after creation. Look for *selectedIssue=*.
* Use Internet Explorer which is not affected by the bug
fields.summary: Page will not scroll to the created issue in Kanban Boards

fields.description:
Starting from Jira Software 8.6.0 and Jira Service Desk 4.6.0 the Users and Roles configuration section has been rebranded.

As a result while displaying the already added Users, the License section (which contained the application the user had access to) is not displayed anymore.

*Before*:
 !Screenshot 2020-06-12 at 15.01.27.png|thumbnail! 
*After*
 !Screenshot 2020-06-12 at 14.16.17.png|thumbnail! 

Moreover while adding a user to Users and Roles, is it not possible anymore to see the e-mail address of filtered users.

*Before*:
 !Screenshot 2020-06-12 at 15.01.48.png|thumbnail! 
*After*:
 !Screenshot 2020-06-12 at 15.04.05.png|thumbnail! 

As a workaround for now it is possible to add the *jira.users.and.roles.page.in.react.disabled* dark feature to restore the previous Users and Roles view.

 * Navigate to the following page to access the Dark Features page:
{code:java}
<baseUrl>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!Default.jspa
{code}

 * Enter *jira.users.and.roles.page.in.react.disabled* in the field “*Enable dark feature*” and clicking on the “*Add*” button, and verify that the dark feature *jira.users.and.roles.page.in.react.disabled* is showing.

However it is not guaranteed that the dark feature will continue to work in future versions of Jira.

The license column and e-mail address have been removed as those details can still be seen from user management of jira.

The concern raised by customer here is that, usually a project admin adding users and groups in project and roles is not also a Jira Administrator and so he is not able to look into jira user management.

So would be good to restore License and e-mail address back into Users and Roles.
fields.summary: restore license section and display e-mail address of users in the new Users and Roles rebranded section

When a Jira administrator wants to connect Jira with Github with DVCS plugin, he/she will need to use the Github organizations account. This is because DVCS plugin requesting "repo" scope:

* https://developer.github.com/apps/building-oauth-apps/understanding-scopes-for-oauth-apps/

Some users consider the "repo" scope to be too permissive.

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the scope used by the DVCS plugin or allow users to configure the scope options while allowing existing DVCS features to work.


h3. Workaround 

None.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When an issue is resolved the dialog "Resolve Issue" shows "Fixed" as default. That is only true for Bug issue types. All other issue types should have a default resolution of "Done"!

So in 95% of our issues we have to click the dropdown and choose Done every time. So annoying.

A Task is done - not fixed. A Story is done - not fixed. An Epic is done - not fixed. An Improvement is done - not fixed. A Feature is done - not fixed. And so on.

So the default resolution for all issue types besides "Bug" should be "Done".
fields.summary: Default resolution should be "DONE"

For instance,we have epics that have multiple stories that are planned for more than one sprints. If we group by sprints, it would be a game changer if that option to see the group by sum of the points. It could be on the view options.

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
The users *with Jira Software license* (and *without Jira Service Desk license*) who links Software issues with ServiceDesk issues, they won't be able to see the field: Issues Linked.

h2. Sample
* There is Project ABC which is a JSD project. 
* User A is a "customer" of Project ABC and can only see ABC tickets via the portal. 
* User A also has the own Jira Software Project called QWE.
* User A opens tickets QWE-1 and ABC-1. 
* User A wants to link those two tickets together and is successful since User A has the "Link Issues" permission. 
** *After linking it, User A can not see the link done between QWE-1 and ABC-1*, since the user doesn't have "Browse Projects" in the JSD project.
**  *HOWEVER, a new log is added in the History tab*. From there, the *user can see the link made*.

h2. Suggested Solution
* The "Linked Issues" field should be shown if users have at least 1 "Browser Project" permissions for 1 of the involved projects. The information is already being shown in the history tab, So why is the Issue Linked being hidden?

h2. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: "Linked Issues" field should be shown if users have at least 1 "Browser Project" permissions for 1 of the involved projects

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I discussed this with a few people, and we all agreed, it would be amazing to have the ability to, "watch" a sprint, just like we watch issues. This would be extremely helpful as a Scrum Master because we need to know when planned scope is changing, when things are being completed (and not completed), when estimates change, etc.. *AND* this information should be able to be utilized via JQL.

I know we can get this at a specific issue level and there is insight into this via the reports section, however building a JQL filter for this data is not user friendly, and as an Administrator this functionality would be nice for regular users to be able to access. _Yes I have been both a SM and Admin._

Ease of use would encourage more people to use the system, and it helps get middle management and leaders more on-board with the tool when it has features that the users love.
fields.summary: Ability to, "Watch" a Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer has developed and installed a plugin (Field sync plugin) which is datacenter and server compatible(same jar for DC and server) in a Jira server instance and he is using a DC evaluation license on the plugin.

This gives a warning "This app has a Data Center license, but the installed version is not Data Center compatible"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Steps to reproduce:
 # Setup a Jira Server (we used 8.6) and enter a normal Jira Server license.
 # Install an app that is both Jira Server and DC compatible.
 # Enter a DC evaluation license for the app.

h3. Expected Results

DC licenses should work fine on Jira Server 
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adjusting the Sprint slider, it is possible to set the number of issues that will be moved out of the Sprint. However, if the Sprint slider is moved, and then dragged back completely, it will remove all the issues in the Sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum Board
# In the Scrum Board, create a Sprint
# Create several Issues in the created Sprint
# Move the Sprint slider up. Notice as you drag the slider up, the issues beneath the slider will be removed when the Slider is released.
# With the Sprint filled with multiple issues, move the Sprint slider above 1 issue, then move it back without releasing the slider. Notice how the number of issues is set to 0, regardless of the actual number of issues in the Sprint
** Should the slider be released, all the issues in the Sprint will be moved out to the below Sprint or Backlog

(i) Screen recording of replicating the problem:  [^SprintSlider.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
When the slider is moved back completely, it will not remove any issues in the Sprint and leave it as is.

h3. Actual Results
All the issues in the Sprint will be moved out to the below Sprint or Backlog

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Moving back completely the Sprint slider causes all issues to be moved out of Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver085/linking-issues-981157062.html] implies (and local testing confirms) that not necessarily all issues are returned from a search when linking an issue based on the value of the Summary field:
{panel}
4. In the *Issues* field, specify the issue(s) to be linked to your currently viewed/selected issue. There are two ways to do this:
 * Type the full issue key (e.g. *ABC-123*) — or to link to multiple issues, press the 'Enter' key between each typed issue key.
 (i){color:red} If you have previously browsed an issue, you can quickly find the issue by typing the first few letters of the issue key (or part of the Summary), which will appear in an 'autocomplete' drop-down list for selection:{color}
 *OR:*
 * Click the *search for an issue* link to use the *Find Jira issues* popup, which allows you to perform either a simple [text search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver085/linking-issues-981157062.html#Linkingissues-simpletextsearch] or an [advanced search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver085/linking-issues-981157062.html#Linkingissues-advancedsearch] for issues.{panel}
h3. Suggested Solution

In order to avoid confusion for end users who experience inconsistent results, it is preferable that searches (when linking an issue) return any matching results/issues (based off the Summary field value) and not just the issues the user has recently browsed to.
h3. Workaround
 # Search based on the issue key *OR*
 # Browse to the Issue View of the issue which is not returning. Subsequent searches based on Summary field value will now include this issue.
fields.summary: Any matching issues should be returned in the linked Issues field when filtering/searching based on Summary field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira 8.8 introduced a new behaviour where users can exclude Sprint created outside the board. In Jira 8.8 and above, if a board does not have any Sprint created on it and the board only display Sprint created outside the board through the board filter, the user will be seeing the following message while viewing Velocity Chart report:

{quote}
There are no available sprints for this board.
{quote} 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new board with a board filter like: *project = SSP ORDER BY Rank ASC*
# On the board, create few Sprints.
# Add some issues to the Sprint.
# Start a Sprint and complete it.
# Repeat the step with the rest of the Sprints.
# Check the Velocity Chart on the board to verify that the Sprints are shown correctly.
# Create a new board with a similar board filter as the original board: *project = SSP ORDER BY Rank ASC*
# Navigate to the Velocity Chart on the board and we will see that report shows *There are no available sprints for this board.* message


h3. Expected Results

* Velocity Chart shows the last completed Sprints.


h3. Actual Results

Velocity Chart shows the following message and no Sprint is shown:

{quote}
There are no available sprints for this board.*
{quote}


h3. Workaround 1

Creating a new Sprint on the board affected board and completing it will allow the Velocity Chart to work again.

* Create a new Sprint on the affected board.
* Add an issue to the new Sprint.
* Complete the Sprint.
* Check the Velocity Chart on the affected board again.

h3. Workaround 2
Making a REST API call to *PUT agile/1.0/board/boardId/settings/refined-velocity* through Postman, Curl or using the Atlassian REST API browser add-on.

h4. Using the [Atlassian REST API Browser|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211542/atlassian-rest-api-browser?hosting=server&tab=overview]
# Let's install the [Atlassian REST API Browser|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211542/atlassian-rest-api-browser?hosting=server&tab=overview] (this is a free tool that will add a REST API interface to help us apply the workaround easily)
 # Navigate to *_Administration > System > REST API Browser_*
 # Make sure the box "Show only public APIs" is *not selected*
 # Enter your admin credentials to display all the REST API endpoints
 # Search for the endpoint called
{code:java}
agile/1.0/board/{boardId}/settings/refined-velocity{code}
 # Go to the *PUT* tab
 # Insert the *boardId* of the board affected (this can be found at the Jira URL when you navigate to the board - it will be the something like "rapidView=2")
 # Click on *+ Parameter*
 # Under the "Parameter" column, insert *value*
 # Under the "Value" column, insert *false*
 # At the "Request Body", make sure that we are sending an empty body like this:
{code:java}
{

}{code}

 # Click on *Send*
 # Check if the Velocity Chart is working again
 # Repeat the process to all boards affected

h4. Using the cURL command in a terminal window
{code}curl -X PUT -u $USERNAME -H "Content-Type: application/json" "JIRA_URL/rest/agile/1.0/board/boardId/settings/refined-velocity?value=false" -d "{ }"{code}
(!) Don't forget to replace the *$USERNAME*, *JIRA_URL* and *boardId* above
fields.summary: Velocity Chart is broken if no Sprint created on Board

	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.GitHubEventServiceImpl$SyncTransactionCallback.doInTransaction(GitHubEventServiceImpl.java:176) [jira-dvcs-connector-plugin-5.2.6.jar:?]
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.service.GitHubEventServiceImpl.synchronize(GitHubEventServiceImpl.java:133) [jira-dvcs-connector-plugin-5.2.6.jar:?]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom field option deletion becomes extremely sluggish for large instances where {{customfieldvalue}} table is massive.
{{/jira/secure/admin/DeleteCustomField!default.jspa}} or {{/secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa}} calls take way too long to finish on the DB SELECT queries causing proxy timeout.

Example:
{code:sql}
# SELECT COUNT(*) FROM customfieldvalue"
   count
-----------
 167999387
(1 row)
{code}

{code:sql}
# SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VAL UETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE CUSTOMFIELD=16616 AND STRINGVALUE='21797' AND VALUETYPE IS NULL"
 id | issue | customfield | updated | parentkey | stringvalue | numbervalue | textvalue | datevalue | valuetype
----+-------+-------------+---------+-----------+-------------+-------------+-----------+-----------+-----------
(0 rows)


real    11m34.465s
user    0m0.007s
sys     0m0.004s
{code}

h3. Environment
* 8.5.x with very big {{customfieldvalue}} table


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1: Create a lot of issues using many "Select List" type custom fields
# Step 2: Try to delete/modify the customfield options

h3. Expected Results
Query is returned in time and custom field options are deleted/modified

h3. Actual Results
* Access Logs:
{code}
127.0.0.1 625x11238113x5 xxxxxx [08/May/2020:10:52:55 +0200] "GET /jira/secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa?fieldConfigId=19083&atl_token=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx HTTP/1.1" 200 17399 1670121 "https://jira.example.com/jira/secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!default.jspa?atl_token=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx_lin&fieldConfigSchemeId=19083&fieldConfigId=19083&customFieldId=16616&returnUrl=ConfigureCustomField%21default.jspa%3FcustomFieldId%3D16616" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:76.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/76.0" "1hoakcc"
{code}

* atlassian-jira.log:
{code}
2020-05-08 10:52:55,404+0200 http-nio-8080-exec-1519 url:/jira/secure/ad...ptions!remove.jspa username:xxxxxxxxx url:/jira/secure/ad...tomfieldoption.jsp username:xxxxxx ERROR xxxxxx 623x11234240x3 1hoakcc 1.1.1.1,2.2.2.2 /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa [webwork.util.ValueStack] query="affectedIssues/size" {[id="affectedIssues" type="8" values=""]} {[id="size" type="8" values=""]}
...skipping...
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE CUSTOMFIELD=? AND STRINGVALUE=? AND VALUETYPE IS NULL (An I/O error occurred while sending to the backend.)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:85)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findByAnd(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:62)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.persistence.OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.getIssueIdsWithValue(OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister.java:83)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CascadingSelectCFType.getIssueIdsWithValue(CascadingSelectCFType.java:128)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.customfields.EditCustomFieldOptions.getAffectedIssues(EditCustomFieldOptions.java:299)
{code}

* execute command directly on db

{code:sql}
# SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VAL UETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE CUSTOMFIELD=16616 AND STRINGVALUE='21797' AND VALUETYPE IS NULL"
 id | issue | customfield | updated | parentkey | stringvalue | numbervalue | textvalue | datevalue | valuetype
----+-------+-------------+---------+-----------+-------------+-------------+-----------+-----------+-----------
(0 rows)


real    11m34.465s
user    0m0.007s
sys     0m0.004s
{code}

h3. Notes
This is the happy flow with very small {{customfieldvalue}} in a test instance:
1. Jira runs this SELECT query to find usage of the custom field option:
{code}
2020-05-10 12:34:19,300+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 754x861x1 1jdq6ii /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa 4ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE CUSTOMFIELD='11300' AND STRINGVALUE='10603' AND VALUETYPE IS NULL"
{code}
2. The returned query result populates the confirmation page:
!2020-05-14_15-14-17.png|thumbnail!
3. Once you hit delete, it iterates through each of those issues with individual SELECT queries followed by the DELETE query to delete the options from each issue keys:
{code}
2020-05-10 12:34:19,607+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 754x861x1 1jdq6ii /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa 1ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='14848' AND CUSTOMFIELD='11300' AND STRINGVALUE='10603'"
2020-05-10 12:34:19,609+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 754x861x1 1jdq6ii /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa 1ms "DELETE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ID='23337'"
--
2020-05-10 12:34:19,613+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 754x861x1 1jdq6ii /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa 1ms "SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ISSUE='14849' AND CUSTOMFIELD='11300' AND STRINGVALUE='10603'"
2020-05-10 12:34:19,614+0530 http-nio-8080-exec-5 admin 754x861x1 1jdq6ii /secure/admin/EditCustomFieldOptions!remove.jspa 1ms "DELETE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE ID='23652'"
--
{code}
etc.

If the first SELECT query takes a very long time, then UI times out even before getting to the confirm delete page and hence becomes very difficult to delete customfield option.

We could potentially bulk update all issues using this value to be deleted before running the delete option call which would reduce the number of times the SELECT query iterations. However, this become cumbersome any ways for large environments.

h3.Workaround
* (/) The workaround would be to add explicit index on the *{{customfield}}* column:
{code:sql}CREATE INDEX customfieldvalue_customfield_explicit_index on customfieldvalue (customfield);{code}
* Increasing the Reverse Proxy timeout value to let the call finish could be one workaround
fields.summary: Delete Custom field options times out due to very large customfieldvalue table

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
DVCS accounts are synchronized using only one thread. The setting {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.threads_per_consumer}} has no effect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a DVCS account in Jira
 # Perform synchronizations that take a long time

h3. Expected Results
Up to {{dvcs.connector.synchronization.threads_per_consumer}} threads should perform the synchronization

h3. Actual Results
Only one thread is performing the synchronization. This is evident by looking at thread dumps as well as log outputs for {{MessageExecutor:thread-1}}, and never {{thread-2}} for example.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: DVCS accounts are synchronized using one thread despite what is set in dvcs.connector.synchronization.threads_per_consumer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As opposed to DVCS, in Subversion commits or revisions are just monotone-increasing numbers and are not unique across different repositories. When the same revision number in two different Subversion repositories have the same Jira issue key associated with them, Jira will incorrectly display:
{quote}You don't have access to view all related commits. Please contact your administrator.{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project and an issue, note down the issue key
 # Create two Subversion repositories
 # Create two revisions in each, with the same number and same Jira issue key (created in #1)  in the commit message
 # Add both repositories to FishEye/Crucible
 # Link both repositories to the Jira project
 # Go to the issue and click on the FishEye/Crucible issue panel

h3. Expected Results
 # See two commits without a permission error

h3. Actual Results
 # See two commits with a permission error

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing a Jira issue with two Subversion repositories connected via FishEye/Crucible can show permission error incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding users in Users and Roles you can't differentiate between users if they have the same name ie John Smith. It would be helpful to have something else next to the name ie email, username or avitar to tell them apart.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 or more users with the same name but different user name
 # Go to Project >Users and Roles> Try adding a user with same name -duplicates show

h3. Expected Results

You would expect username or other to be listed next to name of user
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2020-05-08 at 3.48.00 PM.png|width=449,height=216!

 

If an organization has two employees with the same name this is a challenge.  
h3. Workaround

At this time 2 or more individuals would have to be added and then some deleted to omit the incorrect users.
fields.summary: Can't tell users apart when adding to Users and Roles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Jira Software Server is connected to a repository in github (or possibly bitbucket), and the end user's preferred language is set to Chinese (zh_CN), the name 'branches' is incorrectly displaying as an additional 'commits' entry.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Jira Software Server to a github repo
# create a branch, commit, and pull request each against a single issue (example issue key SSP-23)
# Convert the system language to Chinese OR convert your user profile language preference to Chinese
# Load SSP-23 issue and look at development info

h3. Expected Results
Expecting that these terms would be correctly translated into Chinese OR that if not translated, at least correctly display the terms in English.

h3. Actual Results
No only is the term 'branches' not translated, it is made to appear as the term 'commits' which leaves the end user very confused to see two entries there for commits.

See screenshots below:
When language is in English:
 !inEnglish.png|thumbnail! 
When language is in Chinese:
 !failedtranslationtoChinese.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When language is set to Chinese, the development panel is not translated, and branches is incorrectly showing as commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to edit Sprint when *Remaining Estimate and Time Spent* is enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Enable Remaining Estimate and Time Spent.
# Create a new Sprint in the board.
# Try to edit it.


h3. Expected Results

* User is able to edit the Sprint

h3. Actual Results

* Jira throws *clauseValues is empty* Javascript error and following exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
2020-05-07 20:57:35,901+0800 http-nio-8712-exec-5 ERROR vshanmugam 1257x2833x1 lcbqcc 127.0.0.1,127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/5/start [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: clauseValues is empty
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: clauseValues is empty
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.not(Assertions.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.builder.DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.addStringCondition(DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.java:781)
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.builder.DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.issueParent(DefaultJqlClauseBuilder.java:518)

	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.sprint.StartSprintHelper.loadIssuesInSprint(StartSprintHelper.java:154)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you set up a DVCS account with Bitbucket Cloud in Jira, only the first 10 of a repository's branches are synchronized and the rest are discarded, making the branches not show up in the Development Status Panel in a branch's associated issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a DVCS account with Bitbucket Cloud in Jira
 # Create a repository with more than 10 branches
 # Synchronize the repository with Jira

h3. Expected Results
All branches should show up in associated Jira issues.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first 10 branches in a repository show up in their associated Jira issues.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When synchronizing DVCS accounts with Bitbucket Cloud only the first 10 branches/commits are synchronized

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It's not clear from the documentation [Configuring columns|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-columns-938845277.html] that the rightmost column in a board represents the "Definition of Done".

Any issue that is not transitioned to a status under this column will be sent to backlog or carried forward to a future sprint. 

This is a point of confusion that was raised several times in the community and support tickets: 
* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Random-quot-Done-quot-Issues-Showing-Up-in-New-Sprint-Once/qaq-p/1213798
* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Issues-marked-as-Done-still-appears-in-a-New-Sprint/qaq-p/732831

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the documentation to make it clear. There was a previous similar request to fix the docs in JSWSERVER-2129 but it's no longer the case. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Clarify documentation about "Definition of Done" in board columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user tries to access Profile via "User and roles" screen it always takes /jira as context path not matter which context path is set in server.xml file
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a context path /pm in server.xml file
{code:java}
<Context path="/pm" docBase="${catalina.home}/atlassian-jira" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
{code}

 # Restart Jira server and login to Jira UI: http://<ip address>:<port>/pm
 # After logging in, navigate to Project Setting --> User and Roles --> <Select a User profile>

h3. Expected Results

It will open the User profile with link: http://<ip address>:port/pm/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=admin
h3. Actual Results

It gives the error: 404 page not found since the link is redirected to http://<ip address>:<port>/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=admin
h3. Workaround

Need to manually change the context path from /java to context path set in server.xml file (here /pm) and then it works. However, this is not a perfect workaround.
fields.summary: Link to profiles in "Users & Roles" screen doesn't work

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Currently, we're unable to hide/archive a board from a current project while maintaining access to all of the data and the boards themselves but don't see them as part of our current Jira project.
h3. Why is it important?
It gives great advantage while organizing your project and its boards, facilitating the users' ability
h3. Suggested resolution
As a possible workaround, what we can accomplish is move the board from the current project to a new one, where only a specific group/user has the permission to *Browse Projects* in this new project. Therefore, the board will be unavailable and out of the current project but will keep its configuration.
fields.summary: Archive boards from current project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to create a custom field that allows to configure avatars/emojis in it. More specifically, fields that present a list of values for user to choose from don't offer this possibility.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great to allow for the creation of custom fields (Select list type) where either avatar or emojis can be added. This way, not only Type and Priority fields contain avatars, allowing for a more refined customisation of Jira instance.
h3. Workaround

Use an add-on such as the [Icons for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214988/icons-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] that add a specific type of custom field, which allows the use of avatars.
fields.summary: Ability to add an avatar/emoji to a custom field pick list value

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user does not have permission to view a Board, should they use the Board's URL, they will still be brought to the Board. Though not able to see any Issues and the error message stating that the user is not able to view the Board, they are still able to see the Board's name and Quick Filters' name. This leads to a form of information leak. As the Board's ID is sequential, the user could exploit this further by manually modifying the ID in the URL to view other Boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Board
# Configure the Board's Share (Viewers & Modifiers) to only 1 Group
# Login as a User that is not part of that Group, access the Board via the URL
(i) The Jira instance may need to be re-indexed first
# Notice that the user is able to see the Board and Quick Filters' name despite not having permission to view the Board:
 !BoardError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Board is not accessible at all

h3. Actual Results
Board is accessible. Though the Issues are not viewable, the Board and Quick Filters' names are viewable.
 !BoardError.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Users are still able to access the Board despite not having permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Changing Sprint on issue doesn't always reflect the change on the Board on other Data Center nodes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 parallel sprints and start the sprints
# Assign some issues to both of these sprints
# Open one issue and change sprint (e.g. from Sprint 1 to Sprint 2). This change is instantly visible on the Board on the originating node
# Open the same board on other DC node and see the results

h3. Expected Results
On the Board on the other DC node, the change is reflected (issue assigned from Sprin 1 print to Sprint 2)

h3. Actual Results
The issue doesn't get assigned to the new sprint (Sprint 2), however, the issue gets removed from the old sprint (Sprint 1).
* Switched AG-2 issue to Sprint 2. Visible on originating node 1:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
* On node 2, we can see the issue removed from Sprint 1, but it is not added to Sprint 2:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Update the affected issue, this will update the index and the issue will become visible in the assigned sprint.

h3. Notes
* Index statistics fetched from the REST endpoint:
{code}
{"nodeId":"jira2","reportTime":"2020-04-30T10:44:58.906+0000","issueIndex":{"indexReadable":true,"countInDatabase":5,"countInIndex":4,"countInArchive":1,"lastUpdatedInDatabase":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.336+0000","lastUpdatedInIndex":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.000+0000"},"replicationQueues":{"jira1":{"lastConsumedOperation":{"id":10300,"replicationTime":"2020-04-30T10:40:13.629+0000"},"lastOperationInQueue":{"id":10300,"replicationTime":"2020-04-30T10:40:13.629+0000"},"queueSize":0}}}
{code}
{code}
{"nodeId":"jira1","reportTime":"2020-04-30T10:45:19.064+0000","issueIndex":{"indexReadable":true,"countInDatabase":5,"countInIndex":4,"countInArchive":1,"lastUpdatedInDatabase":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.336+0000","lastUpdatedInIndex":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.000+0000"},"replicationQueues":{"jira2":{"lastConsumedOperation":{"id":10221,"replicationTime":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.367+0000"},"lastOperationInQueue":{"id":10221,"replicationTime":"2020-04-30T10:40:53.367+0000"},"queueSize":0}}}
{code}

*  *Issue is not reproducible on Jira 8.5.3.*
fields.summary: Changing Sprint on issue doesn't always reflect the change on the Board on other Data Center nodes
